description: Retrieves a list of the API keys that you've defined for the specified scope. API keys are required for the integration of the CAPTCHA API in your JavaScript client applications. The API lets you customize the placement and characteristics of the CAPTCHA puzzle for your end users. For more information about the CAPTCHA JavaScript integration, see WAF client application integration in the WAF Developer Guide.

parameters.name: Scope
parameters.description: Specifies whether this is for a global resource type, such as a Amazon CloudFront distribution. For an Amplify application, use CLOUDFRONT. To work with CloudFront, you must also specify the Region US East (N. Virginia) as follows: CLI - Specify the Region when you use the CloudFront scope: --scope=CLOUDFRONT --region=us-east-1. API and SDKs - For all calls, use the Region endpoint us-east-1.

nested_items.name: NextMarker
nested_items.description: When you request a list of objects with a Limit setting, if the number of objects that are still available for retrieval exceeds the limit, WAF returns a NextMarker value in the response. To retrieve the next batch of objects, provide the marker from the prior call in your next request.

nested_items.name: APIKeySummaries
nested_items.description: The array of key summaries. If you specified a Limit in your request, this might not be the full list.

nested_items.name: TokenDomains
nested_items.description: The token domains that are defined in this API key.

nested_items.name: APIKey
nested_items.description: The generated, encrypted API key. You can copy this for use in your JavaScript CAPTCHA integration.

nested_items.name: CreationTimestamp
nested_items.description: The date and time that the key was created.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: Internal value used by WAF to manage the key.

nested_items.name: ApplicationIntegrationURL
nested_items.description: The CAPTCHA application integration URL, for use in your JavaScript implementation.
